doc:
Jeannie Berlin https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeannie_Berlin 0 Jeannie Berlin (born Jeannie Brette May, November 1, 1949) is an American film, television and stage actress and screenwriter, known for her role in the 1972 film The Heartbreak Kid, for which she received Academy Award and Golden Globe nominations. She later played the leading role in Sheila Levine Is Dead and Living in New York (1975), and in 2000s returned to screen appearing in films such as Margaret (2011), Inherent Vice (2014) and Cafe Society (2016), as well as the miniseries The Night Of (2016). In 2018 she played the President of the United States of America in the Hulu original series The First, a science fiction drama about NASA astronauts exploring the planet Mars. Jeannie_Berlin ( born Jeannie_Brette_May , November_1_,_1949 ) is an_American_film_,_television_and_stage_actress_and_screenwriter , known for her_role in the_1972_film The_Heartbreak_Kid , for which she received Academy_Award and Golden_Globe_nominations . She later played the_leading_role in Sheila_Levine Is Dead and Living in New_York_(_1975_) , and in 2000s returned_to_screen_appearing in films such_as Margaret_(_2011_) , Inherent_Vice_(_2014_)_and_Cafe_Society_(_2016_) , as_well_as the_miniseries The_Night Of (_2016_) . In 2018 she played the_President of the_United_States of America in the_Hulu_original_series The_First , a_science_fiction_drama about NASA_astronauts exploring the_planet Mars .
